meanings.definition: A person who eats greedily or voraciously.
meanings.sent1: The gorger at the party finished all the snacks in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The hungry gorger devoured the entire pizza by himself.
meanings.sent3: The gorger at the buffet was like a vacuum cleaner, sucking up all the food.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was a gorger, consuming everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The image of the gorger stuffing his face with cake was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A device used for filling a cask or barrel.
meanings.sent1: The gorger poured the liquid into the cask with precision.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker used the gorger to fill the barrels with wine.
meanings.sent3: The gorger made filling the barrel look like a piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The gorger worked tirelessly, filling barrel after barrel with the liquid.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gorger filling the cask echoed through the cellar.

meanings.definition: A deep, narrow passage or gorge.
meanings.sent1: The hikers ventured into the gorger, surrounded by towering cliffs.
meanings.sent2: The explorers marveled at the beauty of the gorger they discovered.
meanings.sent3: The gorger was so narrow, they had to walk in single file.
meanings.sent4: The gorger seemed to swallow up all sound, creating an eerie silence.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight barely reached the bottom of the gorger, casting shadows all around.
